name: Hotel La Jabotte

reviews.title: wonderful retreat
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from staying 4 nights at La Jabotte and throughly enjoyed our stay. The host's were very helpful in providing information about restaurants and shuttle services. The breakfast was wonderful I loved the fresh jam and croissants. For a true slice of the french life we enjoyed his cocktails or champagne with lavender wonderful. The beach was very enjoyable especially with the umbrellas and beach mats they provided.

reviews.title: Totally idylllic
reviews.text: La Jabotte is fabulous. The perfect hosts, Yves and Claude, spare no attention to detail. Each bedroom is beautifully decorated with individual detail and the breakfast is amazing, freshly squeezed orange juice, fresh fruit, fresh breads and croissants, cheese, yoghurt, homemade jam and freshly baked cake, a cafetiere of coffee or a choice of tea all served outside your window on your own terrace in the garden. This was my third visit and I shall be back soon!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Jobotte is a perfect little spot to stay in Antibes. The property is immaculate and the breakfast area is perfect. The food was great- the attention to detail was impressive. The rooms were very clean. We were there mid-April; the rooms don't get a ton of air circulation, so the room is humid/damp, but nothing major. We found the service to be good- the people were nice and helpful. We didn't spend too much time on-site as we were off exploring all day etc., so we didn't get to know them too well. I would recommend the hotel though- it truly is a beautiful place and great location.
reviews.title: Beautiful Place

likes.disliked: — No picnics/ food in their garden area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at La Jabotte at the beginning of March and the weather was fantastic. This really is a perfect little oasis tucked away just behind the beach. Breakfast was wonderful and everyone was so welcoming and helpful - we can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: The perfect oasis

likes.liked: — great atmosphere and attention to detail

reviews.title: a little piece of heaven in the south of francel
reviews.text: we stayed here in december for a wk end birthday break and it couldnt have been more perfect, the location was superb and a 15 min walk into old antibes along the promanade.,yes the rooms are small but they are perfectly formed and all overlooking the delightful courtyard all one could wish for.Yves was a charming host with attention to detail, he and my husband did everything to make my birthday speicial.If you are looking for a sweet & charming hotel near the beach then look no further!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a weekend and loved the unique hotel we found close to one of Antibes beaches. We found the owners really friendly and Tommy also was pleased to meet us! The breakfasts were just fine, the rooms were clean and the home-decorated pottery (by Yves) is now a feature of my own breakfast table. We can understand why this hotel is No.1 in Trip Advisor for this area. In January, the stone floors were a bit cold but I guess this would be a great boon in the summer. Keep up the great work.
reviews.title: Don't miss this place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at La Jobotte for 2 days as part of a 19 trip to France in October. I have to say we both felt this was the worst accomomdations of our trip. The positives: It is close to the beach and in a quiet area. The owners have decorated the hotel in a "cute" manner and seemed nice but were not overly friendly. The dog was very friendly. That didn't bother me.
reviews.title: Read this before you book

likes.disliked: — small, rustic room with extremely small bath room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negatives: The rooms are basically cinderblock construction that ring a courtyard that is behind the main house where I assume the owners live and the office is located. There is no air conditioning and only one small window in the room. Even in October it was warm at night necessitating opening the window for ventilaition. Unfortunately there was no screens in the window and we were bothered by mosquitoes all night. I had about 20 bites by the next morning. We went to a pharamcy the next morning and purchased repellent. We then applied the repellent generously before going to bed. Even then I could still hear the mosquitoes in the room buzzing around us closely but at least they wouldn't light and bite. The rooms are extremely small and rustic. IF you want close proximity to the beach and don't mind almost cabin like conditions then this could be your place.
reviews.title: Beautiful Little Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Jabotte is beautiful and perfect. The negative comments are completely unjustified as Yves, Claude and Tommy were always so friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful and the breakfasts are fabulous. Look forward to returning!
reviews.title: Fantastic! Didn't want to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 12 nights at La Jabotte and enjoyed every moment. Yves and Claude were charming and very helpful, striking the right balance by providing welcome advice without being intrusive. The cleaning lady was also very friendly and cheerful.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

likes.disliked: — No air conditioning and mold in the showers

reviews.text: We adored our stay at La Jabotte. We spent 6 days mid-July here. The rooms all open onto a cute courtyard where you have breakfast and cocktail hour. Breakfast was delicious - croissants, bread, fruit, and a pastry, all of very high quality. The rooms are very quaintly decorated and comfortable enough. The hotel is a block from the beach, literally. They have beach mats and umbrellas to borrow. The owners are super nice and try really hard. From 6-8 they will make you a "cocktail of the day" (or wine, beer) with something to nibble on, which is a nice relaxing way to end the day and either talk to the other guests or just hang out.
reviews.title: Adored La Jabotte

likes.liked: — Small, unique hotel steps from the beach

reviews.title: Sweet B & B
reviews.text: It's about a 15 min. walk into town from the hotel, easy enough, I think there was a shuttle bus too but we didn't take it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's worth spending a little extra to stay here - we're normally budget travellers but I'd def. return to La Jabotte for the relaxation and "specialness."
reviews.title: An absolute jewel

likes.disliked: — No full bathroom in room, but it was located very close by and not shared by others.

reviews.text: We loved this B&B in Antibes! It's a much more quiet area than Nice, we were glad we chose this location for our first 2 nights in France. The breakfast was great, tea, juice, french press coffee, cheese, croissants, baguettes, jam, fruit, cookies... Tiny rooms but very sweet. Comfortable and great amenities. Owners are very nice and helpful. Old town Antibes is a 15-20 minnute walk from the hotel. The beach is just up the driveway from the hotel. If you do travel with a baby, just let the owners know before you arrive and they may put you in an end room like we stayed in so the baby will not disturb the other guests. Also parking is first come, first serve... There are only 5 parking spots so it may be a problem in peak season, wasn't for us though. This was a great little find and very inexpensive (unlike everything else in europe). Another tip, make sure you know what your rental car will cost, there is a steep tax they charge and we didn't know about this before we went, very expensive! Perhaps use other forms of transportation... But renting a car is the best way to see all the small towns nearby and travel at your own pace.
reviews.title: We enjoyed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this perfectly charming small hotel at the end of April. If you can possibly reserve a room there, do not hesitate for one second. The care and devotion that the extremely creative hosts shower upon their place is evident in every tiny detail. Besides, the location is ideal and the price is a welcome relief for the beleagured holiday pocketbook. You won't be happy if you expect American style amenities - swimming pool, huge rooms, etc. - but if a classical French petit dejuner in the perfumed shade of a citrus tree just outside your door is a satisfactory alternative, then you absolutely will not want to miss a night or two at the exquisite La Jabotte.
reviews.title: The lovely Jabotte

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Jabotte is the most beautiful little property, well-run, in a perfect location. It is more than reasonably priced - it is cheaper than a roadside motel in the US. You are one block up a cute alley to the (great!) beach, a short walk along the seafront to old Antibes, and have great access to the Cap. The rooms are small, set around a central courtyard. Our room was adorable, bright, and cheery - the walls were handpainted with sun designs - the furniture is minimal and unobtrusive - the linens are high quality and very nice. The bathroom is super-modern and they provide cute eau de toilette. Breakfast is great, served outside your room and is delicious, fresh, and nicely presented. The courtyard is the nicest place to sit, and is communal, with people reading the paper, families playing board games, and Tomy, the owners' funny little dog.
reviews.title: La Jabotte is wonderful!
Delightful Experience
reviews.text: The best are the two owners, Yves and Claude, who were unfailingly kind, helpful, and a fun presence (Yves paints in the courtyard during the day, and each takes responsibility for different aspects of running the hotel). One of the nice unexpected touches is the cocktail hour in the evening, when everyone floats in from the beach and Yves makes incredible small cocktails with delicious sides. The presentation is artistic, the food is fun, and the mood is festive.

A final anecdote to encourage you to try La Jabotte: the morning we flew out of Nice airport, we had to leave earlier than the breakfast hour. We expected to have nothing to eat. However, when we came out of our room early that morning, Claude had set out yogurts, little bite-size tarts, and juice for each of us. We didn't go hungry!
reviews.title: Peace, Tranquility and Tommy...
Ahh... Antibes & La Jabotte
reviews.text: We don't have anything negative at all to say about La Jabotte - we've found "our place" in the south of France.

description: Little dollhouse looking at the sea, well located in a quiet little street on the Cap d'Antibes at 50 meters from a sandy beach and 15 minutes walking distance from the old town. 10 charming rooms, 8 on the patio and 2 in the villa, all with air conditioned. Nathalie and Pierre welcome you home!
